abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            rated highly satisfactory. Key lessons learned include: 1)
            It is possible for even a very complex multi-State project
            to be successful with full ownership and commitment of the
            States. 2) Effective coordination and periodic joint reviews
            can lead to cooperation, knowledge sharing and healthy
            competition between project entities. 3) With the current
            emphasis on decentralization, more Bank attention should be
            given to local implementers. 4) In a complex multi-State
            project covering a large number of wide-spread project
            locations, decentralized procurement would be more
            efficient. 5) Timely creation and filling of key staff
            positions with qualified and trained staff is most critical
            for success of an education project to ensure quality. 6)
            The project could have reached a higher degree of success
            with greater institutional autonomy of polytechnics and
            decentralization. 7) The very significant increase in women
            enrollment in polytechnics indicated their keen desire to
            enter new areas like electronics, computers, etc., if proper
            atmosphere and opportunities are created and supported by
            visible policy measures like reservation in employment. 8)
            Technical training of the handicapped needs special efforts,
            tools, and teaching skills.
